review.title: Creating Intelligent Linking for Information Threading in Knowledge Networks
review.abstract: Informledge System (ILS) is a knowledge network with autonomous nodes and intelligent links that integrate and structure the pieces of knowledge. In this paper, we aim to put forward the link dynamics involved in intelligent processing of information in ILS. There has been advancement in knowledge management field which involve managing information in databases from a single domain. ILS works with information from multiple domains stored in distributed way in the autonomous nodes termed as Knowledge Network Node (KNN). Along with the concept under consideration, KNNs store the processed information linking concepts and processors leading to the appropriate processing of information.

metadata.title: Creating Intelligent Linking for Information Threading in Knowledge Networks

sections.heading: A. Structural Rules
sections.text: While the values are replaced by the structural properties of a link, the following structural rules are followed: 1) And / or connectivity between concepts is not explicitly listed: In order to represent the two concepts, they are individually linked to the fact in question. The same is presented logically, as in Fig. 3. Fig. 3 shows that if the knowledge "computer can store, retrieve, and process information," then the three concepts of storage, retrieval, and processing are incoherently linked to the computer concept. 2) Each knowledge unit is a concept: Each knowledge unit is like a concept, and each concept can be represented by a KNN, i.e. each concept is a KNN.3) Assignment of performance properties a) Additive / Subtractive: Some of the concepts add additional information to other concepts, in these cases the connection that connects these concepts is additive.

referenceMentions.context: There has been some development in the field of encoding domain knowledge in a fuzzy multi-layer perceptron (MLP) [1].
Although there have been efforts to interconnect heterogeneous knowledge bases [2], but these systems needed to be connected on the knowledge grid for doing so.
To overcome this, we had suggested Informledge System (ILS) in our work published earlier [3] [4].

The research in the field of knowledge management has shown that knowledge can be viewed in four different ways that primarily includes ontological, epistemological, commodity and community views of knowledge [5].
Ontology originated in the field of philosophy and is defined as a specification of what exists [6].
For different understanding of a concept stated in language, different representations are stated which involve ontological construction [7].
Standard Upper Ontologies [8] have been used to define general concepts at higher-level.
However, it is not yet possible to represent the existing knowledge completely using one kind of ontology [9] [10].
However, it is not yet possible to represent the existing knowledge completely using one kind of ontology [9] [10].
Whereas in ILS, knowledge is represented by interlinked knowledge units, which are ordered set of entities [3].

Although few have been able to understand the deep working patterns of neurons [16], but still a large amount of work need to be done to create knowledge bases that would be able to embed knowledge and links, and link each other in respective models.
Even human brain uses prior knowledge for decision making, through the use of concepts which are formed through abstraction, capture the shared meaning of similar entities [15].

1 whose inner-most sphere consists of the interlinked knowledge units as part of a knowledge, outer to it is the knowledge encoder (KE) [2] which helps in knowledge embedding and retrieval, next to it is the knowledge validation sphere which helps in validation of this knowledge with the stored facts in ILS and the outermost sphere provide the knowledge representation to interlinked knowledge units to form an understandable knowledge.
In our previous paper, we had talked about the knowledge embedding and retrieval strategies [3].
ILS is a modified knowledge network system dealing with logical storage and connectivity of information base to form knowledge using autonomous nodes and multilateral links [3].
The structure of the KNN encompasses four quadrants namely input/output, storage and parser, link database and link manager, as discussed in our last paper [2].

During knowledge embedding the knowledge units, KNNs, get connected based on the following link properties: directional and performance properties, which include exclusive or inclusive, additive or subtractive and integrative or differentiative [3].

Thus for any link between KNNx and KNNy, the link formed is the combination of the properties p1,p2, p3 and p4, As discussed in our paper[3], p1 denotes the directional properties(source/destination KNN), p2 is a combination of three performance properties and p3 is the temporal property.

metadata.abstractText: Informledge System (ILS) is a knowledge network with autonomous nodes and intelligent links that integrate and structure the pieces of knowledge. In this paper, we aim to put forward the link dynamics involved in intelligent processing of information in ILS. There has been advancement in knowledge management field which involve managing information in databases from a single domain. ILS works with information from multiple domains stored in distributed way in the autonomous nodes termed as Knowledge Network Node (KNN). Along with the concept under consideration, KNNs store the processed information linking concepts and processors leading to the appropriate processing of information. KeywordsInformledge System (ILS); Knowledge Network Node (KNN); Multi-lateral links; Link Manager; Ontology
